Articles.Content:
Help me! In my Career, my Apollo 11-esque ship, in LKO, when I try to move the CSM on top of the CSM the LM spins out of control for no reason! I have tweakscale, KIS, KAS, KER, and Mechjeb.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-22T23:06:43Z" title="06/22/2015 11:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 22, 2015</time> by legoclone09**
Just to make sure, you haven't inadvertently mucked with your trim? Think Alt-X will re-center it if you have..

Is your LM manned at the time, or does it have a probe core? If it is manned, does it have a pilot aboard?

I noticed that if I took the only pilot out of a multi-Kerbal craft for EVA, SAS stability assist ceased working.

> 
> I noticed that if I took the only pilot out of a multi-Kerbal craft for EVA, SAS stability assist ceased working.

In career mode, if you don't have an external SAS core installed, this is very much the case.

legoclone09 - I had the same problem and it was [answered by Claw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123492-EVA-causes-ship-to-spiral-out-of-control). The trick is to Alt + X (in my case) before going extra-vehicle.
Alt-x solved the same problem for me. I also found that retreating to 900m from the craft caused it to stabilize so I could get back aboard.

Ok, thanks everyone. I fixed it by turning of the torque in the LM and CSM. It might be from changing physicsSignificance of my heat shields from 0 to 1. I'll test Alt+x when I get the chance, lots of my probes and craft do it. But thanks you!
